data.title: The Flood Drummers (2003)
data.meta_description: Based on the play by Hélène Cixous, filmed in 2002, Tambours sur la Digue is a story written by Hélène Cixous based on an ancient Asian fable about who shall be saved during a flood and presented by live actors as puppets and puppeteers, evoking the theatrical traditions of Japanese Noh and bunraku.
data.text: Arianne Mnouchkine has a way of merging theater and cinema so it becomes greater than either. Live actors as bunraku puppets manipulated by puppeteers in black so their movements are more puppet-like than natural. This heightens the action and creates a visual poem. The film cuts to actors reciting the lines offscreen breaking the fourth wall to remind one is watching a film. Some of the theatrical devices were so beautiful I was gasping. The story told is of greed where there is no justice. Ultimately, the film conveys a message that we are all puppets manipulated by what we do not comprehend.
